trans-unit.source: Notifies the caller about changes to the attributes or contents of a specified registry key

target.mrk: Notifies the caller about changes to the attributes or contents of a specified registry key

trans-unit.source: Handle to an open registry key. The key must have been opened with the KEY_NOTIFY access right.

seg-source.mrk: Handle to an open registry key.
The key must have been opened with the KEY_NOTIFY access right.

target.mrk: Handle to an open registry key.
The key must have been opened with the KEY_NOTIFY access right.

trans-unit.source: This handle is returned by the _WinAPI_RegCreateKey() or _WinAPI_RegOpenKey() function. It can also

target.mrk: This handle is returned by the _WinAPI_RegCreateKey() or _WinAPI_RegOpenKey() function.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the changes that should be reported. This parameter can be one or more of the following values.

target.mrk: Indicates the changes that should be reported.

trans-unit.source: [optional] Specifies whether report changes in the subkeys of the specified key, valid values:

seg-source.mrk: Specifies whether report changes in the subkeys of the specified key, valid values:

target.mrk: Specifies whether report changes in the subkeys of the specified key, valid values:

trans-unit.source: True - The function reports changes in the specified key and all its subkeys.

seg-source.mrk: True - The function reports changes in the specified key and all its subkeys.

target.mrk: True - The function reports changes in the specified key and all its subkeys.

trans-unit.source: False - The function reports changes only in the specified key (Default).

seg-source.mrk: False - The function reports changes only in the specified key (Default).

target.mrk: False - The function reports changes only in the specified key (Default).

trans-unit.source: [optional] Specifies whether return immediately, valid values:

target.mrk: Specifies whether return immediately, valid values:

trans-unit.source: True - The function returns immediately and reports changes by signaling the specified event.

seg-source.mrk: True - The function returns immediately and reports changes by signaling the specified event.

target.mrk: True - The function returns immediately and reports changes by signaling the specified event.

trans-unit.source: False - The function does not return until a change has occurred (Default).
